intro: Micranthes bidens, commonly known as the narrowleaf pimpernel, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of tiny white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and thrives in open, sunny environments. It is often found in prairies, open woodlands, and along stream banks. Micranthes bidens is known for its rapid growth and ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
